info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 9:22AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, northwestern Mercer, central Louisa, southwestern Scott and southeastern Muscatine Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 922 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grandview, or 7 miles north of Wapello, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fruitland around 925 AM CDT. Eliza around 930 AM CDT. Muscatine around 935 AM CDT. Fairport and Illinois City around 940 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Andalusia and Montpelier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
